talk.author: did:plc:pev57m26gc3u3t5oirsiofs2
talk.utter: The lesson of 2016 was when you clear the deck for a preselected candidate it is likely that voter enthusiasm will be very low. Biden has been a very good president, but the polls are clear that we are falling into that same trap again.

talk.author: did:plc:nvfposmpmhegtyvhbs75s3pw
talk.utter: but the deck hasnâ€™t been cleared. people who could be president are *choosing* not to challenge Biden

talk.author: did:plc:pev57m26gc3u3t5oirsiofs2
talk.utter: We can argue about the norms of incumbency or the norms of running at age 81, or the importance of norms, but the polls are clear that voters are not happy with their 1 choice and pushing forward anyway is a huge gamble at this moment in history.
